inn1.comm: slides down leg stump, 142ks, kicks up and surprises Vincent, who defends but the ball clips his thigh pad and sits up
oh thats gone through him! Pacy delivery, sitting up and straightening off  a length and beating a squared-up Vincent, great delivery from Lee
sharp, quick bouncer, 145ks, down leg stump forces him down
a touch fuller, but slipping well down leg stump, raps the front pad as Vincent defends and Lee goes up in appeal, but you're not going to get those, sorry
full down leg stump again, he defends with an inside-edge to square leg
oversteps, and this one, though 146.6ks, again strays well down leg stump and the ball clips Vincent's pad very high ... but more importantly, we have a free hit
and he misses by a mile, swinging lustily at one pitched up right outside off
good start! Pitches just short of a good length and seams across McCullum, pushing tentatively off the back foot and missing, the ball flicks his thigh pad
a touch fuller, but outside leg, and McCullum tries to work it to leg
sees him walking down the track and bowls a full toss, which McCullum cops in the thigh
quick delivery outside off stump, pushed straight to point
pitches full outside leg and he flicks through square leg
just short of a drivable length outside off, he comes forward and pushes to cover
short of a length, comes in and cramped for room, he still cuts past point
banged in short, 149ks and the pace surprises McCullum, attempting to swat it off one leg and the ball goes nowhere fast
full outside leg stump, he shuffles and tucks straight to square leg
very wide, full outside off stump and moving away, he watches it fly by
short of a length outside leg, turned wide of square leg for one more
149ks, very wide and Vincent really has to reach out, but gets some bat on it and sends it speeding through cover and point
wide again, Vincent chases it and drives on the up, losing one hand off the bat, but cant beat point this time
very wide, miles down leg stump and Gilchrist cant stop that one

oh what a catch! James Hopes! Vincent rocks back and slaps a short, wide and rising delivery outside off stump, but gets the outside corner of the bat and the edge flies down to wide third man where Hopes keeps his eyes on it, dives forward, and holds on very well to get Australia an early breakthrough, much to Lee's satisfaction
good length on about off stump, he gets forward and defends to cover
fuller on off stump, bringing him forward again, and he defends it back
full again, and he gets well forward to play it back to Bracken
straighter delivery, How shuffles and works it to midwicket
nice and tight delivery on middle and off, How strides well in to defend
and thats a maiden, as Bracken hits a good length and How defends
short of a length on off stump, McCullum gets in line and defends
short outside off, too quick again and he mistimes the pull to midwicket
another no-ball, McCullum thumps it but cant beat the man at extra cover
well, not quite, but he does get bat on it, slapping a very full and wide delivery, one-handed, up and over gully as the ball dies between three converging fielders
full and there to be driven, McCullum kneels down and drives to Hogg at mid-off
good length outside off stump, he again comes forward and pushes into cover
good length on off, he drives back to Lee, fielding in his follow-through
crunched, McCullum getting onto the front foot and driving a good-length delivery past a diving Hogg at mid-off
good change-up, slower and fuller on off stump, not a yorker by any means but it nearly yorks McCulllum, who walks down the track
short of a length, he sizes it up and looks to club that one into Tasmania, but gets too under it and balloons it over Hopes, back-pedaling at mid-on, and survives as it beats the fielder
short and wide, there to be hit and he does so, slapping past point, top shot
straighter one on middle and off, worked across the line to leg
fullish outside off stump, slower, and he leaves it be this time
starts off with a loosener, short outside leg and they get a leg-bye off the thigh
steams in, bowls it short of a length outside off, he taps it through cover
too full and McCullum presents a full face, pushing past the stumps for two
banged in short, McCullum goes for the pull but the ball hurries onto him before he knows whats happening, at over chest height, the ball clips his glove and flies over Gilchrist, very quick delivery
short again, a touch wider, good carry to Gilchrist as McCullum leaves
full outside off, he takes a hand off  the bat as he slashes to Symonds at point
tight line, good length on middle and off and How watchfully defends
again, terrific line, no room at all, right on off stump and How has to defend
a touch wider but How doesn't move his feet, attempting to cut, and misses
touch straighter, How shuffles across and flicks straight to midwicket
good length again, off stump, and How defends to Ponting at silly mid-off
just short of a good length, extra bounce too, and How pulls out of the shot
too wide down the stumps, and Gilchrist has to move to right to collect
again, his line's all wrong, too full down leg and the ball clips his pad to run fine
just too full on leg stump and McCullum uses the pace to whip that over square leg for four, safe shot
and the reply is a bouncer over the stumps, forcing him down on the haunches
full and wide, McCullum flashes hard and gets a thick outside edge to third man
full outside leg stump, flicks straight to square leg this time, its leg-byes
fullish on off stump, he gets bat and pad together, pushing through cover
nice length, middle and off, and he just gets forward and defends
too good from Bracken, no room to work with and How textbook-defends
marginally wider but same result, How defending to Symonds at point
pushed across How, on a length, and all he does is leave it be
fullish length and he just blocks to Ponting, thats 20 balls faced and no score
this time he leaves off the front foot, very coolly ... not sure what the intent is
short outside off stump, McCullum rides the bounce and steers to gully
full down leg, he tries to work it fine, the ball clips his pad and runs to point
bang, thats four! McCullum cracks - no, thumps - a short and wide delivery through cover before any fielder can even move, woof that was hard!
slower and fuller, outside off, sucking him out of his crease and as he drives, the bat clips ground after the ball passes, hence the muted appeal
ah he's slapped the pants off that one! Again, Tait offers plenty of width outside off and McCullum cuts hard through cover and point
more runs, Tait pitching full, McCullum slashing an airy drive over point this time
full on leg stump, How finally gets off the mark with an on-drive through midwicket, its in the gap and they proceed to run four singles
full and shaping away from How, who comfortably goes back to leaving
pitches outside off and comes in, with extra bounce, catching How on the forward press but thats too far over the stumps for the umpire to uphold the appeal
straightens and he shuffles, working a single through square leg
lovely slower ball, but a good piece of adjustment from McCullum, rolling the wrists and keeping it down, just, in front of midwicket
full outside off stump, he gets well across and shoulders arms
on the money, straightening from middle stump, gets an inside-edge and McCullum aggressively calls for the sharp single
good length on middle and off, drawing McCullum forward to defend
good length, short of a drivable length, McCullum gets forward and leaves
short on middle and leg, McCullum walks across and tries to pull but the ball hurries on him, clipping the bat and thudding into his chest before dying near his feet
biffed! Lee serves up a half-volley and McCullum clubs that superbly through the covers, forcing Ponting to hop up at short extra cover, no one's catching that!
and thats his fifty in style, McCullum driving another full delivery through cover
good length outside off stump, he drives and gets an inside-edge to leg
full on middle and off, he shapes to flick but gets a thick outside-edge that flies through the gap at gully and down to third man
angled down leg and he works it off the pads to short fine leg for two
good length outside off, he comes onto the front foot and opens the face of the bat, steering a couple wide of backward point with ease
short of a length on the stumps, he shuffles and aims to work it to midwicket but ends up playing it back to Hopes
slower ball, on a good length and McCullum watchfully defends to Hopes
fullish outside off stump, he gets forward and drives to mid-off
short of a good length, How gets over it and defends to Symonds at point
good length, moving in to How, who's early into the drive to extra cover
whats this, a single? How gets onto the front foot early and steers a no-ball through gully for one .... so again, Lee has issues overstepping ...
oh he's absolutely nailed that! Shuffles across in his crease, walking to leg and then getting Lee to bowl it very wide, only for McCullum to sway back and thump a flat six over point
short of a length on off stump, McCullum stands tall and defends to Lee
short of a length again, good bounce, but McCullum gets up and defends
starts off well, nipping the ball back off the seam but its sliding down leg, catching  How on the hop, and the umpire shakes his head ... and replays show an inside-edge
straighter one on the stumps, How gets in line and defends
this one's wide and How eases it down to third man for one
slower one, on middle and leg, nicely worked towards midwicket
pitches down leg and McCullum taps it to midwicket again
short of a length, he gets up and drives, Hopes dives to his right and stops
looped up on off stump, he shuffles and taps it to square leg
thats a full toss outside off stump, which is paddled past square for two
a touch too full on off stump and he paddles nicely around the corner
flatter one, full outside off, he gets forward and drives to cover
flighted outside off stump, spins in as he works it to midwicket, muted appeal
flat this time, on a length, and he gets over it to defend
short of a length, nipping back, nicely pushed into the covers for a sharp run
short of a length on middle and off, worked toward midwicket this time
identical length, good bowling, and he can only work it to midwicket again
short one, How gets over it and pulls through square out to the sweeper
straighter one, off stump, McCullum gets  back and drives to mid-on
good length, How gets forward and pushes to Symonds at short cover
looped up on a length, spins into off stump and he defends to cover
quicker, bouncier, beating McCullum as he backs away and misjudges the length and misses out on the cut, well bowled
errs this time, bowling full on middle and leg and its swept hard over square leg
again flighted on the stumps, McCullum sweeps to short fine leg
flatter trajectory, sits up off a length and McCullum gets tall to defend to point
flat again, on off stump, he gets across and works it to midwicket
good length on off stump, uses his feet and drives back to Hopes
short of a good length, he stands up and drives back to Hopes once more
this one's fuller and draws a leading edge as he shapes to flick, but the ball drops safely wide of Clarke at point
full and wide, he comes forward and steers to Clarke at point
gets forward and taps one just wide of Clarke for a quick single
slow on a length just outside off, How gets well over it and defends
full outside off stump, McCullum drives and gets a chancy inside-edge past leg
slower one, full on off stump, he flicks streakily past midwicket
overpitched outside off stump, he gets forward and drives to extra cover
How gets four! Tait bangs it short but How unleashes a flat-batted swat over midwicket
good pace, 148.6ks, pitches on a length and beats How on the front foot
full and wide, he leaves it be to end the over
tossed up outside leg stump, worked off the pads straight to square leg
nice flight on that one, middle and leg, McCullum gets forward to tap it back
shorter, over middle stump, he makes room and cuts wide of backward point
flighted up on off stump and How gets over it, watchfully smothering the spin
now he uses the feet, collecting it on the full and clipping wide of midwicket
pitches outside leg and straightens, he shuffles and nudges around the corner
beats him, hitting a short length and straightens to size him up
again, hits a short length and zips past him
full and wide, he gets half-forward and leaves it be
short outside off stump, he swivels and pulls to midwicket

edged and gone! Tait produces a wicket, out of the blue, with a good-length delivery moving away off the scrambled seam - looks like he rolled the fingers over that one - that How fends for with minimal footwork, and Hayden holds a good low catch to his right at slip
short of a length, 146ks, sits up and Styris allows it go past safely
short into the pads, he gets up and works it around the corner for one
flighted up on middle and leg, tucked to the fielder
again, good flight but outside leg and Styris defends to midwicket
flatter one on the stumps, he gets down and paddles to square leg
good piece of bowling, as Hogg flights up the wrong 'un, beating Styris in the flight as he anticipates the spin wrong and survives with a thick edge to third man
flatter one, he goes back and pushes into the gap for one
tossed up full and McCullum makes sure to get right over it
good length but outside leg, Styris gets back and pushes wide of midwicket
good length outside off, he gets forward and pushes into the covers
a touch fuller, he uses the feet and drives just wide of Hogg at mid-off
shuffles in his crease before coming forward and steering wide of point
gone! Fuller length does it for Styris, tentatively coming forward and feeling for it outside off stump only to hand Gilchrist a regulation nick behind the stumps!
short of a length, sits up at a decent height but Taylor covers it well, defending
full and flat on middle and off, McCullum kneels down and sweeps for one
clumped! Hogg serves up a gift-wrapped full toss and Taylor doesn't disappoint, simply hitting that shocker rows back over deep midwicket
looped up on leg stump, he tucks it to short fine leg for a single
slower one, flighted on a length and it gets McCullum in a tangle, paddling
well flighted outside leg, he again tries to sweep but ball kisses pad and flies up
flatter one, spinning across him and he follows it, playing down to point
quickest of the day, 152.7ks, short, wide and rising away, McCullum backs away and gives it the kitchen sinks but cannot get bat on it
theres' the wannabe yorker, just off the mark, and he edges through gully
fullish, nipping back off the seam as McCullum stretches well forward and misses the defensive shot and gets rapped high on the knee roll, and well over the stumps
pitches full outside off, McCullum square-drives hard out to Hussey at sweeper
slower one, leg stump, he adjusts and works it to midwicket
full outside off stump, he gets forward and shoulders arms
slower ball first up, outside off, he gets over it nicely and works into the gap
pitches outside leg and slides down, Taylor mistimes his attempted nudge
too straight, allowing Taylor to flick wide of short fine leg, Tait gives chase
short, Taylor gets up and pushes to Clarke at point, on the bounce
short again, Taylor gets back to dab it wide of Clarke this time, running hard
fuller length, Taylor waits for it and defends with soft hands in front of cover
short of a length on off stump, he hops up and defends to cover
nice slower one, very full and McCullum has to dig that out to cover
this is a low full toss, McCullum drives back past Bracken to long-on
slower one, leg stump, Taylor works it to midwicket
angles across him off a length, and Taylor steers it with an open face
another low full toss, McCullum uses his feet to drive through extra cover, moving past his previous best of 86, well played
tight line and length, no pace, and Taylor defends back to Hopes
good length outside off, he gets forward and steers it wide of point
slower one, full and sliding down leg, he kneels down and sweeps, misses, and HawkEye suggests it was missing middle stump
short of a length, pushed into the gaps for one this time
good length outside off, he gets a huge stride across and runs to gully
pitches on leg, off a length, and McCullum works it towards square leg
nice full ball in the zone, Taylor can only push back to Bracken
too full on the pads and he clips out to deep midwicket for one
moves into McCullum off a short length, he does well to make room and work a sharp single in between Clarke and Symonds in the covers
full on middle and leg, he flicks but cant beat Ponting at midwicket
too straight again, and as he flicks a superbly athletic Ponting fields again, this time after he moves right back on the ring
good length, a touch wide, he covers across and dabs it past gully
short of a length on the stumps, he gets in line and pushes to long-on
short of a length, comes in and he opens the face, running it to third man
straighter one, he shuffles and pushes to mid-on
good length, McCullum waits and pushes towards point for one more
slower one, full too, he tries to work it to midwicket but mistimes to mid-on
slower one, McCullum prods forward and draws an inside-edge to midwicket
short and wide, Taylor sizes it up and cracks it into the covers for one
short of a good length, getting him onto the front foot, and he cant beat cover
slower one, rather full, McCullum leans forward and drives lazily on the up and Symonds throws himself around at cover to save runs
walks out of his crease restlessly, Lee follows him with a short one but McCullum rides it well, using the wrists to angle a cut through gully for one
marginally short of a cutting length, Taylor chops into the ground and beats a diving Symonds at cover this time
short one, angled into McCullum, who gets up and runs it to Clarke at point
fizzed up, straightens outside off and beats Taylor, pushing forward
a touch too full, he walks into it and drives past Hogg to long-off
flat spinner on middle stump, he shuffles and works it past square leg
tossed up nicely, he gets across and works one
looped up on leg stump, he turns it easily to square leg
full on leg stump, Taylor flicks hard past square leg
short one into the ribs but he gets over it, tucking wide of midwicket
sharp bouncer down the stumps, Taylor hooks but cant connect, pacy delivery!
fuller length outside off stump, he uses bottom hand and drives to mid-on
too full and Taylor gets onto the front foot to drive hard past cover and point
slower, clever change of pace beats McCullum,  pushing away from the body
straighten on leg stump and McCullum tucks it straight to midwicket
badda-bing, badda-boom! Hogg proposes, Taylor accepts, simply getting down and swinging a nice loopy one over deep square leg for half a dozen
quicker and flatter, very full, and he digs it back out to Hogg
and would you believe that? Hogg gets McCullum four short of a maiden hundred, sucking him out of his crease, only to get him smacking straight to Bracken, running in from long-off
tossed up on off stump, he gets forward and defends
flighted up well outside off stump, Oram pads it away, Hogg appeals, but the umpire shakes his head
tossed up wide again and Oram plays it away to with ease
fullish outside off stump, hurriedly tapped towards extra cover, cant beat him
fuller, hint of swing, Taylor gets to the pitch and drives to mid-off
good length on about off stump, he shuffles and works it to mid-on for one
short of a length outside off, Oram stands his ground and pushes to point
tight stuff, short of a length and forcing Oram to defend watchfully
very full on middle and leg, Oram picks it and flicks through square leg
slowly tossed up, he gets forward and pokes that to Clarke at point for a sharp single, excellent running between those two, good to see
slowly flighted up, full, on leg stump and Taylor flicks to short fine leg
tossed up gently, spins down leg stump and hits Oram's pad, muted appeal
quicker one, good loop, pitches outside off and goes the other way to beat him
spins down leg, Oram doesn't pick it well and misses out on the sweep
flighted up, sucks him forward, spins and bounces to beat Oram with a big stride forward, Gilchrist takes off the bails but the third umpire says not out
bouncer over off has Taylor ducking, Gilchrist clapping, and Adelaide cheering
good change of pace, Taylor reads it and taps it to Clarke at point
good tight stuff, hitting a length and Taylor cant beat midwicket with the nudge
attempted yorker doesn't work out too well, ending up a very low full toss which Taylor clips back down the ground to long-on for a well-run triple
well bowled, short on middle and leg, Oram jumps up to keep it down
shortish outside off, no room to really free the arms so Oram chops to point
good grief, thats the third time Hogg has served Taylor a chest-high full toss and he duly slogs that rows back over square leg for six more
and again, just too full and Taylor murders that, flat and clean as a whistle, over midwicket
slower one, flighted on a length and now he defends watchfully
flights it up down leg and stump, he waits and nudges it around the corner
full and flat on middle stump, Oram sweeps through square leg
served up full on the pads and he wristily turns it past short fine leg
good length outside off, seams away and draws the outside edge to third man, where Hopes slides around and cuts off runs but that is Taylor's fifty, after a while, just to boost his confidence
moves in off a length, cramping him, he chops into the ground to cover
full in the zone, slower one, Taylor manages to get bat and clip to midwicket
clears his front leg to biff that over extra cover, Lee follows up with a very slow one, seam-up, which moves away and Taylor doesn't  play a shot
Lee strikes! Its full, Taylor comes forward, looking to go on-side, but gets a leading edge that Tait comfortably holds onto at mid-off, and a good innings comes to an end
short of a length on the stumps, Oram defends to cover, getting back
flighted up outside off stump, Sinclair gets to the pitch and drives to cover
flighted up outside off stump, Sinclair goes inside-out to cover again
drifts onto leg stump, Sinclair flicks but cannot beat midwicket
nicely tossed up again, inviting the drive, Sinclair obliges but cant beat cover
flatter one, middle stump, getting Sinclair driving back to Hogg
flighted up on a length, he gets forward but just cant beat the ring
full outside leg stump, Oram clips out to the man in the deep
banged in short on the stumps, Sinclair gets up and taps to midwicket
slower one, wide of off stump, Sinclair chases it and pushes wide of point
short outside leg stump, nicely flicked off the hips and through the gap
yorker ends up down leg, Sinclair just gets bat on it and chops to square leg
fullish outside off stump, Oram stands and drives to Ponting at cover
and he wastes no time, keeping it in the slot, Sinclair has a free swing from the crease, not getting enough elevation and Hogg holds on well inside the ropes at long-on
full and on leg stump, easily worked past square leg for a couple
full outside leg, and Vettori tucks that through midwicket
good length outside off stump, he frees the arms and cuts to point
short of a good length, Oram stands up and pushes to cover
too full outside leg, flicked well but Symonds dives excellently and saves runs
slower one, misdirected well down leg, Vettori nudges it to short fine leg
full outside off, reaches out and steers towards gully, its another no-ball
nothing, closing his eyes and slogging at a full one down leg, only to miss
short one dug in outside off stump, swing and another miss from Vettori
well directed change-up, the Lee yorker, which is well dug out to point
full and very wide, Oram reaches out and guides to Bracken at third man
good length outside off, Vettori swings across the line to midwicket
full toss outside off stump, Oram likes it and heaves it through midwicket
another full toss, this time very wide, Oram slashes out to deep point
nice slower yorker outside off stump, flicked to mid-on and he runs through
low full toss, he loses a hand off the bat as he slogs, edging past leg stump
attempted yorker slides down leg stump, Vettori flicks with a thin inside-edge onto his boot and the ball runs down to fine leg
good length delivery, comes in and cramps Vettori so thats a dot ball to finish
fullish length, Oram makes room and tees off, miscuing it  over mid-off
full on leg stump, Vettori clips through square leg out to the sweeper
again he comes out, looking at midwicket, but gets a thick edge to third man
full and wide, Oram clears the front leg and slashes over gully out to Hogg
full on the stumps, he again clears himself and slogs out to deep midwicket
shorter one, outside off stump, Vettori cant beat backward point
full outside off stump, he gets across and lofts that down to long-on, safely
very full outside off stump, Vettori swings and misses, and has to dive back
low full toss outside off, Vettori collects it and swings to deep square leg
full outside off stump, looks close to being a wide but not called
again, very full outside off, Oram makes room and slashes over gully
very full outside off, Vettori can't get under it, but gets bat on it to pick up an inside-edged, sprinted three down to fine leg
Vettori exposes the stumps, shuffles, Tait bowls it full just outside off stump and somehow the ball misses knocking them down
whew, he's taking his chances well, again exposing all three stumps and just managing to get bat on ball, actually its middled well, from off stump down to third man for two
speared in on leg stump, Vettori clears the front leg and drives to mid-on
top shot, just making room and carving a wide one through extra cover
oh well tried, Clarke! Oram bludgeons a rocket damn hard to mid-off, where Clarke flings himself across to his left but cannot hold on with one hand, but my that was hit ever so hard

bowled! Vettori walks right across the stumps, well outside off in an attempt to play one of those en vogue paddles to fine man, but inside-edges onto leg stump to hand Tait a third wicket with his final ball
full outside off stump and Oram edges down to Tait at third man, getting two
full and even wider, drawing a thick outside-edge that doesn't carry to third man
full outside off stump, nicely carved backward of point to get Oram back
lovely slow ball just outside off, Oram walks across and gets beaten by the pace yet still drives to long-on and sprints back for the second
this hits a shorter length and has Oram in a mess, attempting to heave it on-side, the ball drops at his feet and he calls for one
excellent way to finish the innings! Mills likes the width and the length and carves that flat over the covers for a six to get New Zealand to 254

inn2.comm: on the off stump, driven to the off side
fullish and on the off, late swing in to the batsman, defended back down the pitch to the bowler
overpitched and on the pads, Gilchrist has a big swing at this, off the pads to the on side
this one is again a touch too straight, swinging in to the pads, Gilchrist times this over the infield towards midwicket
this time floated through outside the off stump, going across the batsman, driven hard at, off a thick inside edge down to the on side
Right in the slot, full and on the off, Gilchrist makes no mistake with this one, powering over the leg side for the first boundary of the innings
short of a length on leg stump, well tucked wide of mid-on for a triple
much fuller, off stump, swinging in but Gilchrist counters with a punch to cover
and thats nothing more than a thick edge, flashed away through slips and gully, wasn't a bad delivery from Gillespie, just hit very hard past second slip
good length delivery, sublime stroke, driven on the up past cover and mid-off
strays onto leg and Gilchrist tucks it straight to Taylor at square leg
ooh thats a very full one, honing into him, which is dug out with an inside-edge
full on off stump, driven straight and Mills fumbles in his follow-through
full and wide, half-volley, struck well but Vincent dives at point to save runs
attempted slog, not timed well and it drops just wide of the man in the deep
well driven, Gilchrist comes forward and drives past mid-off for three more
tight delivery, short of a length on middle, moving away, Hayden defends
slightly astray and Hayden turns it wide of Martin at short fine leg for one
oversteps, Hayden drives straight to Vettori at mid-off, so a free hit
can't cash in, shuffling and square-driving a fullish delivery straight to point
short of a length, he hops back in line and pushes one to mid-on
a tad full and Hayden drives wide of mid-off, where Vettori chases and cuts it
bludgeoned, a fairly well-struck shot, to a fractionally wide ball, past extra cover
and thats too straight, so Hayden clips a superbly-run three past mid-on
short on leg stump, goes for the short-arm pull, takes it on the upper thigh instead and the ball rolls to point
walks down and slaps a short ball from outside off stump to midwicket
hello, he's literally smoked that, collecting from outside off stump and depositing it rows back over midwicket, where a gentleman in the stands holds a good catch!
he's not stopping, kneeling down and slog-sweeping a slower ball from off stump down to deep square leg, off the bottom of the bat but still went for four
a touch full outside off and Gilchrist, driving on the up, raises the 50 in no time
slower one, full on off stump, drives back to Mills who gathers and fires it back, ouch, some aggression from the bowler, who's taken a beating
good length outside off stump, he drives with an inside-edge to leg
good length outside off, Hayden comes forward and pushes to extra cover
has a stroll down the pitch, Martin smartly fires in a full one, but Hayden still gets enough bat on it to sneak a single to midwicket
slower one, on a good length, forces Gilchrist to watchfully drive to mid-off
gets hurried as he tries to swat it over mid-on, the ball scurrying onto him and the result is a crude back-handed drive to cover
but thats orthodoxy, by Gilchrist's standard, leaning back and square-driving a wide length delivery though cover and four

would you get a load of this? Martin gets Gilchrist nicking a great delivery, moving and rising off the seam, away from him, McCullum collects, they all celebrate as Gilchrist drops his head and walks off .... but then comes the call for no-ball! So its a free hit to boot .... ah, cricket
full in the blockhole, he hammers back to Martin, who jumps up and fumbles, giving away a singe to midwicket, that was hit hard too
he has hit that into next week, I kid you not! Gilchrist! Woof, thats a massive mow across the line, from one way outside off stump, onto the deep midwicket roof
ouch, that's making 'em smart, this time Gilchrist drills it on the up past mid-off
a full toss, pushed into the covers to raise a fifty from 26 balls, take a bow, champ
slides down leg stump, tucked straight to short fine leg

smart catch! Hayden, as is his wont, saunters down the track a touch, Mills pitches short, the ball slows up on him and comes on slower than expected and as he hops up he returns a catch which Mills accepts over his head, so thats a breakthrough they'll take
good length, seam-up, Ponting pushes forward and edges past gully
full outside off stump, wide, he plants the front leg forward and leaves
good use of the feet, meeting a good-length ball with a firm drive past mid-off
down leg, rapidly turned to Mills at short fine leg, well stopped
short of length outside off, Gilchrist gets over it and runs it down to third man
short of a length again, Ponting does a tip-and-run to point, softly played
and the fun ends, as Gilchrist dances down, trying to go over mid-on, but gets underneath a seam-up short delivery from Martin and top-edges to Taylor, back-pedaling in the covers
good length, seaming away outside off stump, and Ponting leaves it be
short of a length, he goes onto the back foot and drives to How in the covers
good length outside off stump, asking him to drive, but he shoulders arms
short again and Ponting stands tall on one leg, driving to Vincent at cover

good ball, jagging back off the seam, from outside off stump, and catching Ponting in front of the stumps but the excess bounce lets him off, as replays indicate as well, but that was some screaming appeal from Mills to umpire Davis
a touch fuller and he drives off the front foot, failing to beat point
good length ball outside off stump, Clarke watchfully lets it go through
short of a length outside off stump, he gets up on the toes and pushes to cover
scorcher, driven off the front foot through a diving cover fielder for four, wasn't a half-volley as such, just driven well on the up
good length ball outside off, Clarke shuffles forward and defends to point
short, lively ball sits up from just back of a good length and forces Clarke to fend, the ball takes the handle of the bat, well played
this one's fuller and driven back through Martin, getting a hand to it, to long-off
just short of a good length, and a tad wide, Clarke steers to gully
good length outside off, Clarke gets half-forward and defends to point
shorter on middle and off and its turned through midwicket for a single
gets forward initially, then leans back as he sees the short ball and cuts to point
tight delivery, back of a length on off and he shuffles across to defend
straighter one, he moves across and then works it to midwicket
beaten! Martin pitches a fraction wide, Clarke plays from the crease, and misses, as the ball narrowly misses kissing the outer edge
fuller still, and wider, so Clarke gets well forward and shoulders arms
pitches on a length and does enough to let Clarke get across and leave
another good length ball outside off stump, and again Clarke leaves it be
pitches fuller and comes in and he gets forward, driving to extra cover
plants well forward and defends a length ball to the fielder at cover
good length outside off stump, Ponting comes forward and defends
just back of a good length, Ponting eases forward and defends again
sits up a touch wider, and gets him going back to tap into the covers
close call, Clarke gets into his drive early and nearly pushes to Mills at mid-off
good stuff, short of a length on off stump, getting him up to defend it back
takes the liberty of driving a fullish delivery back over Gillespie's head, and though not timed all too well it beats the fielder's chase to dribble over the ropes
good length ball on the stumps, he gets in line and pats it back to Martin
he gets down and drives a length ball to Vincent at point
doesn't get to the pitch of this one and digs it into the ground, coming forward
well timed, Ponting driving a length ball on the up between extra and mid-off
fraction wide of off stump, he gets forward and drives to backward point
a touch wide again and he cuts into the covers for a single
too wide and he drives off the front foot, hard and through the covers in a flash
a fraction wide, he gets back and cuts wide of point for one
short of a length, he gets back and drives to cover
touch wider again, comes forward but can beat the bowler though
fuller on the stumps, shuffles and clips wide of midwicket, runs hard
walks into an inviting full delivery outside off stump and drives in the air, wide of mid-off, and runs four as the ball slows up down near long-off
good length outside off stump, comes forward and drives to cover
short of a length, Clarke stands tall and drops it in front of point, good single
close! Ponting tucks to midwicket, starts off, says no as Taylor swoops in, Clarke is stranded, fielder has a shy but misses ... Clarke was not even in the frame
short of a length, slower too, Ponting eases back and drives, losing one hand off the bat, smack through the covers
quicker one, shorter, hustling him onto the back foot to defend
good ball again, sitting up and getting him to drop the head and defend
stars off on a good length, Ponting gets forward and keeps it out to point
fractionally short, Ponting leans back and cuts just wide of point for one
short of a length, gets tall and watches it back to Oram
short of a length, from that high arm, Clarke covers off and defends to point
short of a length, this time there's a bit of width so he plays it to point
steps out of his crease and slices  it to Taylor at cover, who has a shy and almost gets his man, but alls well in the end
starts off short, slides on with the arm and Ponting cuts wide of point
tossed up on a length, getting Clarke to stand and defend it back
spins off a short length, Clarke makes room and cuts to backward point
well flighted wide of off, Ponting gets well forward and runs it to point
uses his feet, comes forward, drives back towards mid-off
tossed up on a length and Clarke defends it back to cover
bit of room outside off stump, uses it to cut towards backward point
short, he goes to pull, stays low and he gets a top-edge over fine leg, where Mills gives chase but cant get there
short of a length outside off, gets up and pushes to cover off the back foot
short ball again, now he pulls through midwicket out to Sinclair on the ropes
short of a length on off stump, gets back and works it to the fielder
good length ball this time, getting him forward to drive back to Oram
tossed up on leg stump, Ponting waits and paddles to square leg
short and flat, spins in, Clarke exposes the stumps and cuts to short third man
short again and this time Pup picks the gap wide of point
dances down, isn't to the pitch but follows through with a firm slash through the covers, out to the sweeper
flighted up on the stumps, there's no turn as Clarke stretches well forward and sweeps through square leg for a well-timed boundary
again he comes out, and Vettori adjusts the length, bowling it quicker, but Clarke goes on to drive hard to long-off for two more
short of a good length on middle and off, he shuffles and tucks to midwicket
short of a length again, he gets in line and defends to point
too short, too inviting and Ponting paddle-pulls - cool word, eh? - past square leg and wide of Mills at fine leg
short and coming in, he adjusts and runs it down towards point, going back
another short one, rising and cramping him at a lively pace but he goes through with his drive, slashing up and over a diving point
short of a length on off stump, Ponting gets into position and plays to mid-on
tossed up on a length, he gets forward and defends it back
short and wide, spins away, Clarke cuts to backward point
tossed up, he gets forward, sees the length and goes back to cut to point
quicker and flatter on leg stump, Clarke gets cramped and plays it back
tossed up on a length, he gets well forward and defends
skips down the track, collecting it on the full and whipping it away for four
good length outside off stump, he gets well forward and defends it back
short outside off stump, he has plenty of time to rock back and cut past cover
good length this time, he gets in line and watchfully defends it back to Oram
short of a length and on the off, Ponting goes for the pull but it is early on the shot. Off a thick inside edge back onto pad
good-length ball on the off stump, defended back down the pitch with a straight bat
short of a length and on the off stump, defended back down the pitch
tossed up, still wide, he gets back and nudges a single
fuller and on the pads, worked to the on side, and it's starting to rain quite steadily now
fullish and on the stumps, defended
short of a length and outside the off, cut in front of point
touch quicker, gets forward and drives it to the fielder
a touch fuller, he shuffles and works it to midwicket
short of a short length, off stump, he gets in line and defends
good length outside off stump, he plants his foot out and shoulders arms
short of a driving length, but Ponting stands tall and pushes on the up to cover
good length ball, well bowled, getting Ponting onto the forward press
full on the pads, he clips it wide of midwicket, top shot that
another top shot, driven on the up past a diving extra cover to raise 150
tossed up on a length, he gets back and pushes to wide mid-on
flighted up on the stumps, he drives down the track but Vettori intercepts
short ball now, Clarke cuts but cant beat point
another short one, he leans forward, then back, and cuts to point
fuller on leg stump, Clarke gets over it and flicks to midwicket
hits a length and spins away, Clarke chases it finally gets one to point
good length on off stump, Clarke comes forward and drives to cover
short of a drivable length, Clarke comes forward and drives to extra cover
hits a good length and Ponting pushes off the front foot into the covers
good length outside off stump, he comes forward and drives to extra cover
good length again, he comes forward and mistimes the shot to Martin
short of a length, sits up a touch to sneak past his attempted cut
tossed up down leg stump, Ponting shuffles and works wide of square leg
uses his feet, Vettori bowls it flat, Clarke on-drives for one anyways
looped up invitingly, Ponting gets really forward and almost misses the spin
too short, allowing Ponting room to lean back and lace past cover
tossed up on middle and off, Clarke walks forward and defends
that nearly got through, spitting and kicking up as Clarke misses the cut
just too short and Ponting pulls through midwicket, with only three men there
this time he finds the gap on the offside, reaching out and square-driving between two men and the ball flies across the damp outfield, it was so well struck
thats a pick-up shot, Ponting getting the back leg up as he whips one from outside off stump over mid-on's head to make it three in three
short outside off but he mis-hits it into the ground in front of midwicket
he survives, slashing one up and over two men in the covers, the ball ballooning up and dropping safely ahead of them as they run back
timed, Clarke flicking a straighter one wide of backward square for four
flat and short, middle and off, Ponting hops back and pushes to cover
comes forward, sees its short, moves back and cuts towards point
looped up on a length, lands on stump and straightens, Ponting gets a full stride in and takes it on the pad, with an inside-edge, Vettori appeals, Mark Benson not interested
tossed up on the stumps and this time he gets further down to defend
looped up nicely outside leg stump, defended back to Vettori
a touch too short allows him to retain strike with a cut to point
full on middle and off, Ponting straight-bats past Gillespie's hand for one, as Vettori slips and slides at mid-on and cuts it off
hits a good length and straightens, Clarke shoulders arms off the front foot
short and wide, he gets up tall and pushes to cover
bouncer sails down leg stump, and the umpire signals wide
short outside off, stays low but Clarke pulls down to fine leg for one
short of a good length, Ponting comes forward and drops it to point
good length, nips back in off the seam, Ponting drives with an inside-edge
nice and straight, Clarke gets forward but cant get Vettori away, driving it back
sees him coming and fires it in on leg, drawing a forward defensive shot
spins on with the arm, but its short, so Clarke cuts through point for one
short outside leg stump, straightens but Ponting hustles to slap it through leg
tossed up invitingly, Clarke comes down and ends up defending it back
uses his feet to skip down and collect it on the full, whipping to midwicket, where Sinclair dives and saves runs
short of a drivable length, but Ponting goes for it and finds Vincent at cover
short outside off, stays low, Ponting pulls anyways and finds the gap
leans forward and chips a full delivery over mid-on and runs four
good length outside off, he leans forward and drives to How at cover-point
short of a length on leg, he drives with an inside-edge, then runs hard
short outside off stump and he cuts it to backward point
starts off drifting down leg, he shuffles and taps it to short fine leg with ease
good length outside off stump, he leans forward and defends to cover
straighter one, good roll of the wrists gets him a single past mid-on
short and wide, he waits and glides it off an open face to third man, touch shot
better length, off stump, he gets forward and defends it back
too straight and full on leg stump, Clarke flicks right to short midwicket
short and wide, Ponting cuts late, backward point dives, but cant stop that
short and even wider, real trash, except Ponting mis-hits it to extra cover
fuller in length, he uses the feet and mistimes the off-drive to midwicket
even fuller, and now Ponting gets a thick inside-edge through square leg, as he advances and drives towards cover, on the up
the reply to two inside-edges is a good bouncer, forcing Ponting down
short of a length, Ponting inches forward and drives, on the up, to point
make that 47, as he crunches a short, wide one past a diving point
good length ball, pitching and straightening to draw a thick edge to third man
gone for 48! Clarke reaches out to a wide one and hits it firmly to Vincent at cover, failing to keep it down, and I think there was some swing on that ball
fullish length again, he gets forward and defends to cover
fuller in length, he drives with an inside-edge to midwicket
good length ball, he gets forward and gets one streakily to third man
short of a length, he gets tall and defends down to his feet
good length again, Symonds gets over it and plays to the fielder
short of a length outside off, no room though, and he has to defend to point

Oram spills one! Banged in short, Symonds tries to hook, the ball takes the bat high on the splice, then pops up in the air to midwicket, where Oram follows it over him, cups his palms and lets it in and out
overpitched outside off stump, Symonds gets forward and drives to cover
good length outside off stump, he drives loosely and french-cuts to fine leg
short of a good length outside off stump, Symonds doesn't move at all as he flirts with it outside off and misses
this time he plays at it late and gets a thick edge to gully, safely on the ground
slower, fuller, Ponting gets a good stride in and shoulders arms, and the ball comes back in pretty close to off stump
not a bad ball but driven on the up, in style, through two men at cover and point
overpitched on off stump, he turns the bat in his hands and works wide of Martin, at mid-on, and Oram, at midwicket
change of pace, hits a good length and has him defending back to Mills
swings down leg, Symonds misses the flick, ball clips pad, McCullum leaps across to his left and pulls off a terrific save, a befuddled Gillespie lets out a muted appeal then goes quiet
short of a length outside off stump, Symonds gets tall and defends it down
slow bouncer over leg stump, Symonds goes for an odd sort of paddle-pull, right near his face, and narrowly misses
good length outside off stump, he gets forward and drives to extra cover
short of length on middle and leg, turned to midwicket
lucky! Symonds swats at a bouncer and edges high over McCullum's head
short and a bit wide, he drives backward of point and moves on to 98
short and wide, sits up nicely, Symonds rolls the wrists over it, picking the gap backward of point as well and third man covers good ground to slide and keep them to three
good ball, hitting a length and moving away, but Ponting gets across outside off stump to counter the swing, tapping it to midwicket and calling for one
short of a good length on middle and off, Symonds thuds forward and blocks
short of a length, coming back in and cramping him, but he chops wide of slip

there it is, hundred number 24, fifth against New Zealand, and first at this ground as he pushes forward to a wide length ball and runs it wide of  backward point for a single, calmly raising his bat to celebrate an effortless hundred, studded with some fine off-side strokes
sharp lifter outside off, Ponting gets up on the toes and pulls out of the shot
short, very wide, going away, he gets up and slaps it to How at point, now thats a dangerous shot
short of a length, middle and leg, sits up but he rides the bounce, shuffling and keeping it down with soft hands between square leg and midwicket
no one moves, as Symonds plants his leg forward and drills a half-volley between cover and mid-off for four
short of a length, comes back off the seam and he defends to point
short and wide, he rolls the wrists and slaps through backward point ... he's overstepped so we have yet another free hit in the game
superbly bowled yorker into leg stump and he can only drive back to Gillespie
short and wide, he reaches out and slaps to backward point
how did that miss? Symonds swats across the line, cannot get bat on it, the ball misses the off bail by a whisker
still short and wide, he runs that right through gully's legs for a single
too short and staying low, Ponting nonchalantly swings it though midwicket
slower ball, ends up a low, low full toss which he drives to extra cover
comes half-forward and french-cuts past leg stump to fine leg
aye, thats way too short and wide and Symonds clangs it to deep point
strays down leg stump and Symonds glances to Mills down at fine leg
and its the captain who clinches the deal, walking into a length delivery and driving past mid-off for a couple and just carrying on towards the pavilion
